intro: Linaria bipunctata, commonly known as the two-spotted toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have a distinctive two-lobed structure. Linaria bipunctata is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
